channel.title: My own forum/website script!
channel.description:
I made my own forum/website script with a little help from some online communities. I have the forum 80% finished and I want to get the security problems fixed up before I continue. I think I got all of it fixed up but you never know. So if you want to help test it for me I put it online at:
http://www.uncutweb.com
If you find anything could you post them please? Also I could use some opinions on how to make it better as well. Thanks to everyone from mopar!
Current VERSION: BETA 2

item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

Also, Do you know how to make it so that the topic with the newest last post shows up on the list first? I have it set to just go from oldest to newest topic. But how to I factor the post in?

Do I need to use some kind of time system for the forum? If so how would I do this?

item.title: My own forum/website script!
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

Tables are meant to display data and not to be used as the layout, and it’s not being used as the layout. And the site strangely moves back in forth because your browser’s scroll bar disappears when the page isn’t long enough that it needs to be scrolled…

I am making a new look anyway.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 11, 2008, 04:48:24 pm[/size][hr]OnlyOneRule:

I have gotten only so far with the edit page, Got any pointers?

[code]<?php
$pagetitle .= “Forums (New Topic)”;
$rootaccess .= “…/common/includes/”;
include ($rootaccess.“scriptheader.php”);
include ($rootaccess.“header.php”);
include ($rootaccess.“header_main.php”);
$site = ‘http://www.uncutweb.com’;
$post = $_GET[‘post’];
/if( $editPostArray[‘poster’] != $_SESSION[username] ) {
header( ‘Location: /’ ) ;
die();
}/
if( $forum > 4 ){
header( ‘Location: /forums’ ) ;die();
} else {
if (empty($_SESSION[username])){
echo’You need to be logged in to post!’;header( ‘Location: /’ ) ;
}
else{
$post = $_GET[‘post’];
$topic = $_GET[‘topic’];
$forum = $_GET[‘forum’];
$error = $_GET[‘error’];
if (!empty($_POST[content]))
{
$sessionresult = mysql_query(“SELECT * FROM members WHERE username = ‘$_SESSION[username]’”);
if (!$sessionresult) {
echo 'Could not run query: ’ . mysql_error();
exit;
}
$usersession = mysql_fetch_row($sessionresult);
$bad = array(“shit”, “fuck”, “ass”, “nigger”, “bitch”, “pussy”, “dick”, “boob”, “whore”);
$_POST[‘subject’] = str_ireplace($bad, “”, $_POST[‘subject’]);
$_POST[‘content’] = str_ireplace($bad, “”, $_POST[‘content’]);
$content = substr($content, 0, 6000);

//topic = $_GET[‘topic’]; you don’t need this line
// Assign some variables.
$ip = $_SERVER[REMOTE_ADDR];
$poster = $_SESSION[username];
//$topic = $topic;
$membernumber = $usersession[0];

$content = htmlentities($_POST[content], ENT_QUOTES);
$subject = htmlentities($_POST[subject], ENT_QUOTES);
$important = 0;
$all = $subject & $content;
require_once($rootaccess."connect.php");

// Register him.

if (empty($all)){
header( ‘Location: /forums’ ) ;die();
}else {
//it was

$editPostQuery = mysql_query(“SELECT * FROM posts WHERE id = ‘$post’”);
$editPostArray = mysql_fetch_assoc($editPostQuery);

$query = mysql_query("UPDATE 'posts' SET `subject` = '$subject' , `content` = '$content'")
or die ("Error 112: The data you inputed got rejected by the server."); //server will auto-generate ID for topic

}
header( “Location: /forums/?topic=$topic&justposted=true”);

exit();
}
if ($error == ‘true’){echo’

You did not fill in all of the fieldsPlease fill all of them in before posting a new topic.

’;}
echo ’ 
	<form action="" method="post">
		<table width="400" border="0" align="center" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="1">
			<tr>
				<td width="100%" colspan="2"><h1 class="registration">Posting New Topic</h1></td>
			</tr>
				<td width="100%">Subject: </td><td><input type="text" name="subject" size="25" value="'. $_POST[subject] .''.$editPostArray['subject'].'"></td>
			</tr>
			<tr>
				<td width="100%">Content</td><td><textarea rows="10" name="content" cols="40" value="'. $_POST[content].''.$editPostArray['content'].'"></textarea></td>
			</tr>
			<tr>
				<td width="100%"colspan="2"><input type="submit" value="Submit"></td>
			</tr>
		</table>
';} } include ($rootaccess."footer.php");?>[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: My own forum/website script!
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

Ron:

- Don’t use tables, it’s just a waste of page load time. They can easily be replaced by divs and you know how to use them so that shouldn’t be a problem. Using divs instead of tables is also good for Search Engine Optimization (SEO), so even more ad revenue because its easier for search engines to grab your content and keywords.

Tables are good for displaying tabular data or things such as forum posts. So if used for the correct purpose, they’re definitely not a waste of page load time.

Read full topic

item.title: My own forum/website script!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Looks very professiona.

Here is what I thought.

  • It does seem to have an awkward layout due to the black and white. There are more colors. You could also add insignias near the edges or over the corners.
  • The login.php has 2 login areas. I saw it after I registered.
  • I registered as Ron but when I logged in with ron in lowercase, it showed “Welcome ron! You’ve been successfully logged in.” I suggest having an extra spot in your database for how the user wants his/her username shown to others in the correct case. So when people register, they will be able to set how it’s shown to add more of a user-friendly vibe.
  • In members.php, if an avatar is used, it widens the height of the cell. Your text is not centered meshing with the feel poorly.
  • The layout moves strangely when clicking to the next page. Click each of your navigational links from left to right and you will see the entire layout in 2 different locations.
  • Instead of putting “Click here to logout” maybe just put “Logout”
  • Your website doesn’t validate w3’s XHTML validator or their CSS validator
  • Don’t use tables, it’s just a waste of page load time. They can easily be replaced by divs and you know how to use them so that shouldn’t be a problem. Using divs instead of tables is also good for Search Engine Optimization (SEO), so even more ad revenue because its easier for search engines to grab your content and keywords.
  • I liked how it resized the avatar if it’s too big, it resizes it.
  • I also liked how images are backgrounds because it makes selecting text without selecting the images.

~Ron

Read full topic

Can you give me any tips on making a post edit page? I know how to get users to post data into the database but I’m not sure how to let them edit a specific row in a database.

Also how would I make the topics that had the most recent reply go towards the top? I only have it ordered by the newest topic.
